Description: Upper body sherd with turn to rim of Attic red-figured pottery krater; interior glazed black with reserved band; exterior: reserved at junction with rim; decoration consisting of female figure (part of head in sakkos remaining) to right; at right, part of torch with two black dots and flame in added purple.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1086)
